section.title: Behavior
section.para: The site Rtimer is a relative timer. It takes as an argument a number of milliseconds to wait. It waits for exactly that amount of time, and then responds with a signal.

example.caption: Simple example of using Rtimer
example.programlisting: -- Print "red", wait for 3 seconds (3000 ms), and then print "green" println("red") >> Rtimer(3000) >> println("green") >> stop

example.caption: Timeout
example.programlisting: {- Publish the result of a Google search. If it takes more than 5 seconds, time out. -} result <result< ( Google("impatience") | Rtimer(5000) >> "Search timed out.")
